item.title: Texas Man Gets Prison Time for Facebook Hoax About Covid-19 Patient Licking Grocery Items
item.description:
A Texas man has been sentenced to 15 months in prison for posting hoaxes on Facebook that falsely claimed he had paid someone with covid-19 to lick items at two grocery stores in San Antonio, according to the U.S. Department of Justice.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Matt Novak

item.title: Why Facebook, WhatsApp, and Instagram All Went Down on Monday
item.description:
Facebook, your uncle’s favorite source for information on how 5G is making everyone communist, experienced a six-hour outage Monday. And it wasn’t just Facebook—the company’s other major platforms, Instagram and WhatsApp, were also down. We finally got a statement from Facebook overnight about what happened, and the…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Matt Novak

item.title: Kobo's New E Ink Tablet Is a Cheaper, Smaller reMarkable Alternative
item.description:
As excellent as the reMarkable’s writing experience is, the device is big, pricy, lacks an ebook store, and doesn’t have an illuminated screen. With its new $260 Sage, Kobo is introducing a smaller and cheaper e-note that’s still an excellent e-reader with access to the expansive Kobo ebook store and the added plus of…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski

item.title: A Hiker Must Keep to the Path (or Else) in Horror Short Narrow
item.description:
A backpack-toting woman trudges through what looks like a sun-baked field of grass, fiddling with a water bottle that’s got just a few drops left in it. Things would only seem mildly dire if she hadn’t also just passed another woman, sprawled in a heap a few feet off the trail, screaming in agony for help—and with a…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Eddy

item.title: What Does the Venom 2 Post-Credits Scene Mean for Marvel's Future?
item.description:
Sony teased it. Official Twitter accounts have joked about it. And now, after a massive $90 million opening lots of fans have seen it. We’re talking about the end credit scene of Venom: Let There Be Carnage and, below, we’ll discuss it and let you tell us what you think it could mean.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Germain Lussier

item.title: First Birds Rescued From California Oil Spill
item.description:
After more than 126,000 gallons (or 3,000 barrels) of crude oil spilled out of a broken pipeline in Huntington Beach, California, this weekend, the first reports on affected wildlife were released Monday. Cautiously, it’s so far, so good—but there’s still a long way to go.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Molly Taft

item.title: Tinder Is Getting Its Own In-App Currency
item.description:
If there’s one thing Tinder was missing, it’s of course some kind of unnecessary in-app economy. Well, good news: Now you can spend Tinder Bux on your ceaseless quest to get laid, so long as you’re in the land down under.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tom McKay

item.title: V/H/S/94 Is a Grimy, Gory Found-Footage Throwback
item.description:
The first V/H/S movie came out in 2012, arriving at the tail end of the low-budget found-footage horror craze (Paranormal Activity and REC came out in 2007; Cloverfield was 2008) and capturing the last moment in culture before VCRs became totally obsolete. Two sequels followed, with 2014's V/H/S: Viral embracing phone…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Eddy

item.title: Here's How TikTok's Parent Company Reportedly Wants To Take On Amazon
item.description:
China’s ByteDance has already seen wild success with TikTok, its social media subsidiary that’s turned into a massive thorn in Facebook’s side. Now, it looks like the company is stepping into Amazon’s turf, too. Insider was first to report on Monday that ByteDance is planning on building an international shopping…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shoshana Wodinsky

item.title: Android 12 Is Here, Sort Of
item.description:
Welcome to yet another confusing software rollout from Google: After months in beta, Android 12 has officially been released. However, it’s not rolling out to smartphones everywhere just yet. If you’re expecting the update to Android 12, hang tight: it’s coming in the next few weeks.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Florence Ion

item.title: Netflix's Streaming Shuffle Feature Is Coming to Android
item.description:
If you’ve ever sat helpless in front of the hundreds and hundreds of movie and TV show options on Netflix, unable to decide which specific type of mindless content to settle into for the night, you’re in luck: After launching its “Play Something” instant-streaming shuffle feature on connected TVs last April, Netflix…

Read more...
item.category: apple ipod nano portable audio device
item.dc:creator: Brianna Provenzano

item.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife and Reebok Cross the Streams for New Sneakers
item.description:
Reebok is no stranger to pop culture collaborations, having partnered with both Jurassic Park and Alien. Heck, the company even released Ghostbusters sneakers last year, inspired by the full uniforms of Venkman, Spengler, Zeddemore, and Stantz. The collection must have done well, because Reebok has debuted a much…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Rob Bricken

item.title: Acer's New Windows 11 Laptop Is Better for the Environment
item.description:
Gadget makers have come up with a couple of tactics to curb e-waste and prevent plastic from heading straight to the landfill. On the one hand, you have devices like the Fairphone 4 and the Framework laptop, which seek to reduce waste by making gadgets easier to upgrade and repair. On the other, you have systems like…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Sam Rutherford

item.title: You Don't Really Need to Upgrade to Windows 11, but It's Good
item.description:
More than six years after the release of Windows 10, Microsoft is releasing the next big chapter in its ubiquitous OS on Oct. 5. A recent survey suggests that more than 60% of people aren’t even aware that Windows 11 is coming out, which indicates there probably won’t be a mad rush to upgrade.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Sam Rutherford

item.title: Clearview AI Says It Can Do the ‘Computer Enhance’ Thing
item.description:
Sketchy face recognition company Clearview AI has inflated its stockpile of scraped images to over 10 billion, according to its co-founder and CEO Hoan Ton-That. What’s more, he says the company has new tricks up its sleeve, like using AI to draw in the details of blurry or partial images of faces.

Read more...
item.category: road signs in the united states
item.dc:creator: Tom McKay

item.title: A 'Lost' 125,000-Year-Old Mangrove Forest Is Thriving in Mexico
item.description:
Over 100 miles from the Gulf of Mexico, an ecosystem of salt-tolerant trees is flourishing along a freshwater river. A team of researchers recently investigated how this verdant oasis got so side-tracked from its typical habitat, and they found that the forest was stranded inland during the last interglacial period…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Isaac Schultz

item.title: IATSE Has Voted in Favor of a Nationwide TV and Film Strike
item.description:
In a move that’s likely going to escalate tension throughout the film and TV industries, an overwhelming majority of the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees members voted in favor of approving a nationwide strike that could bring all productions to a grinding halt.

Read more...
item.category: international alliance of theatrical stage employees
alliance of motion picture and television producers
trade unions in the united states
item.dc:creator: Charles Pulliam-Moore

item.title: Urban Heat Is Getting More Dangerous
item.description:
Urban heat is more dangerous—and even deadly—than ever. That’s true for two reasons: Globally, more people are flocking to cities, and cities themselves are getting hotter due to the climate crisis.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dharna Noor

item.title: What to Know About the Film Crew Shooting the First Movie in Space This Week
item.description:
A Roscosmos Soyuz rocket is scheduled to launch Tuesday morning from the Baikonur cosmodrome, sending a Russian film crew and one cosmonaut to the International Space Station. Here are the details of the mission and how you can watch the launch online.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: George Dvorsky

item.title: YouTube Music Is Bringing Free Background Listening to Canada
item.description:
If you’ve ever used your phone to listen to music on YouTube and wished so badly that the tunes would keep cranking while you navigate to other apps, then you know how delighted Canadian YouTube users will probably be when they soon get to experience that exact joy. And hopefully, that’s a sign it’s coming for the…

item.dc:creator: Brianna Provenzano

item.title: American Born Chinese Coming to Disney+ From Shang-Chi Director
item.description:
Destin Daniel Cretton—director of the biggest movie of 2021: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings—has settled on his next project. He’ll direct and executive produce a Disney+ adaptation of American Born Chinese, a 2006 graphic novel written and illustrated by Gene Luen Yang. Kelvin Yu (Bob’s Burgers) will serve…

item.dc:creator: Germain Lussier

item.title: Why We Need Fat Bear Week
item.description:
After a summer of opulence and excess comes the lean time—the long, dark winter, when resources must be hoarded and stretched. No one knows this better than the fat bears of Alaska’s Katmai National Park and Preserve.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Brianna Provenzano

item.title: The Nevers' Mysterious Alien Creature Gets the Spotlight in This Behind-the-Scenes Clip
item.description:
“Elephant, octopus, T-rex”—those are the three inspirations that helped VFX designers craft the Galanthi, the giant, glowing alien that was maybe the weirdest part of HBO’s overall rather weird The Nevers. In a new clip from the special features of the forthcoming home video release, VFX supervisor Johnny Han, series…

item.title: Should You Upgrade to the Apple Watch Series 7?
item.description:
When Apple announced the Series 7 last month, it left out exactly when you’d be able to buy it. That made sense, given murmurs of production delays related to the Series 7's new design. But now we know: The Apple Watch Series 7 will be available for preorder starting at 5 a.m. PDT/8 a.m. EDT on Oct. 8, with general…

item.dc:creator: Victoria Song

item.title: Ben Affleck Finally Had Bat-Fun Making The Flash Movie
item.description:
Ever since the first picture of Ben Affleck in the Bat-suit was released from Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, in which the Dark Knight looks forlornly at the ground directly before him, one thing was obvious: Ben Affleck did not seem thrilled to be wearing a cape for a slew of DC superhero flicks. Knowing what we…
